intro: Diplotaxis stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited burrweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments and has a low, spreading habit. Its fruit is a dry, segmented capsule that contains several small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The species is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
